verbose_text: Compared with group C, the levels of aspartate aminotransferase (AST), gamma-glutamyl-transferase (gamma-GT), total bilirubin (TB) and alkaline phosphatase (ALP) in group B began to increase at 1 week after surgery, peaked at 2 weeks (AST 506.83 +/-154.12 U/L; gamma-GT 93.67 +/-25.15 U/L; TB 42.88 +/-14.38 mumol/L; ALP 806.25 +/-147.08 U/L), decreased at 3 weeks after surgery, and became normal at 5 weeks, which was statistically significant.
evidence: levels of aspartate aminotransferase (AST), gamma-glutamyl-transferase (gamma-GT), total bilirubin (TB) and alkaline phosphatase
